interval_messages.name: trading_principle_1
interval_messages.message: Smart Position SizingğŸ“ Effective trading starts with knowing how much to risk per position. Allocate between 0.5% and 2% of your total account balance to any single trade, depending on volatility and conviction. â–¶ï¸ Why? This prevents emotional decision-making and protects you from "all-in" mistakes. One bad trade should never wipe out days or weeks of progress.

interval_messages.name: trading_principle_4
interval_messages.message: 4ï¸âƒ£ Risk-Reward Must Always Be AsymmetricalğŸ” You must never risk more than you stand to gain. â–¶ï¸ Target minimum reward-to-risk ratios of 2:1 or 3:1. This gives you a huge mathematical edge: even if you're right only 40% of the time, you will still grow your account sustainably.

interval_messages.message: Drawdowns Are Part of the GameğŸ“‰ No strategy, no matter how sophisticated, avoids losses. â–¶ï¸ Drawdowns are statistically inevitable â€” even professional funds plan for 10â€“20% portfolio drawdowns during tough cycles. interval_messages.name: trading_principle_5
interval_messages.message: Always Respect CorrelationsğŸ”— Trading correlated instruments (like EUR/USD and GBP/USD) effectively increases exposure to the same directional risk. â–¶ï¸ Diversification isn't just multiple trades â€” it's uncorrelated trades. interval_messages.name: trading_principle_6
interval_messages.message: The Importance of Pre-Defined StopsğŸš« Having a clear stop-loss before entering a trade is a fundamental principle of professional risk control. â–¶ï¸ Stops create discipline. Without them, it's easy to hold losing trades emotionally, hoping for reversals. Always decide where you're wrong before you commit capital.

interval_messages.name: trading_principle_9
interval_messages.message: Never OverleverageğŸš« Leverage is a double-edged sword â€” it can accelerate gains and losses. â–¶ï¸ Professional traders control leverage carefully. Using conservative leverage allows your strategy's true edge to show over time, without random variance wiping out your capital in the short term.

interval_messages.name: trading_principle_10
interval_messages.message: Long-Term Thinking WinsğŸ“ˆ Trading should be viewed as portfolio building, not daily gambling. â–¶ï¸ Think like a fund manager: focus on consistent risk-adjusted returns over months and years.
